content: Is the rust-lang-deprecated github org an official rust-lang thing? Looks like some repositories from rust-lang/ were moved there at some point.
it was official at some point, but it was "officially we want to forget about these things"
just trying to get a bit of an overview of (current and former) 'official' crates, and trying to make things a bit consistent in deprecation notices in readmes and crates.io owners etc.
looks like there's also a github org just named deprecated with two rust crates.
IIRC that was going to be more of a community-led effort
I don't know a ton about that though

i just went over the list of repositories co-owned by the rust-lang:libs team on crates.io. i'm not sure which of those are/were considered 'official' rust-lang crates and which ones we just have access to because of some other reason. not that there was ever a proper definition the word 'official' here i suppose.

Mara said:

looks like there's also a github org just named deprecated with two rust crates.

It's actually named depre-crated. Seems like they offered to take over maintainership of a couple official crates.
oh! lol, that r is easy to miss.
